intro: Pavetta utilis, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Pavetta utilis is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
